properties.description: The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the add-on.

properties.name: src
properties.description: (Required) The source URL to display in a frame in the PagerDuty UI. HTTPS is required.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the escalation policy.

properties.name: teams
properties.description: (Optional) Teams associated with the policy. Account must have the teams ability to use this parameter.

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Optional) A human-friendly description of the escalation policy. If not set, a placeholder of "Managed by Terraform" will be set.

properties.name: num_loops
properties.description: (Optional) The number of times the escalation policy will repeat after reaching the end of its escalation.

properties.name: rule
properties.description: (Required) An Escalation rule block. Escalation rules documented below.
Escalation rules (rule) supports the following:

properties.name: escalation_delay_in_minutes
properties.description: (Required) The number of minutes before an unacknowledged incident escalates away from this rule.

properties.name: targets
properties.description: (Required) A target block. Target blocks documented below.
Targets (target) supports the following:

properties.name: type
properties.description: (Optional) Can be user, schedule, user_reference or schedule_reference. Defaults to user_reference

properties.name: id
properties.description: (Required) A target ID
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: action_json
properties.description: (Required) A list of one or more actions for each rule. Each action within the list is itself a list.

properties.name: condition_json
properties.description: (Required) Contains a list of conditions. The first field in the list is and or or, followed by a list of operators and values.

properties.name: advanced_condition_json
properties.description: (Optional) Contains a list of specific conditions including active-between,scheduled-weekly, and frequency-over. The first element in the list is the label for the condition, followed by a list of values for the specific condition. For more details on these conditions see Advanced Condition in the PagerDuty API documentation.

properties.name: catch_all
properties.description: (Optional) A boolean that indicates whether the rule is a catch all for the account.

properties.name: depends_on
properties.description: (Optional) A Terraform meta-parameter that ensures that the event_rule specified is created before the current rule. This is important because Event Rules in PagerDuty are executed in order. depends_on ensures that the rules are created in the order specified.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Optional) The name of the service extension.

properties.name: endpoint_url
properties.description: (Optional) The url of the extension.

properties.name: extension_schema
properties.description: (Required) This is the schema for this extension.

properties.name: extension_objects
properties.description: (Required) This is the objects for which the extension applies (An array of service ids).

properties.name: config
properties.description:
• config - (Optional) The configuration of the service extension as string containing plain JSON-encoded data.

    Note: You can use the pagerduty_extension_schema data source to locate the appropriate extension vendor ID.

    » Attributes Reference
The following attributes are exported:

properties.name: id
properties.description: The ID of the extension.

properties.name: html_url
properties.description: URL at which the entity is uniquely displayed in the Web app
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: start_time
properties.description: - (Required) The maintenance window's start time. This is when the services will stop creating incidents. If this date is in the past, it will be updated to be the current time.

properties.name: end_time
properties.description: - (Required) The maintenance window's end time. This is when the services will start creating incidents again. This date must be in the future and after the start_time.

properties.name: services
properties.description: - (Required) A list of service IDs to include in the maintenance window.

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Optional) A description for the maintenance window.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Optional) The name of the schedule.

properties.name: time_zone
properties.description: (Required) The time zone of the schedule (e.g Europe/Berlin).

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Optional) The description of the schedule

properties.name: layer
properties.description: (Required) A schedule layer block. Schedule layers documented below.

properties.name: overflow
properties.description: (Optional) Any on-call schedule entries that pass the date range bounds will be truncated at the bounds, unless the parameter overflow is passed. For instance, if your schedule is a rotation that changes daily at midnight UTC, and your date range is from 2011-06-01T10:00:00Z to 2011-06-01T14:00:00Z: If you don't pass the overflow=true parameter, you will get one schedule entry returned with a start of 2011-06-01T10:00:00Z and end of 2011-06-01T14:00:00Z. If you do pass the overflow parameter, you will get one schedule entry returned with a start of 2011-06-01T00:00:00Z and end of 2011-06-02T00:00:00Z.
Schedule layers (layer) supports the following:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Optional) The name of the schedule layer.

properties.name: start
properties.description: (Required) The start time of the schedule layer. This value will not be read back from the PagerDuty API because the API will always return a new start time, which represents the last updated time of the schedule layer.

properties.name: end
properties.description: (Optional) The end time of the schedule layer. If not specified, the layer does not end.

properties.name: rotation_virtual_start
properties.description: (Required) The effective start time of the schedule layer. This can be before the start time of the schedule.

properties.name: rotation_turn_length_seconds
properties.description: (Required) The duration of each on-call shift in seconds.

properties.name: users
properties.description: (Required) The ordered list of users on this layer. The position of the user on the list determines their order in the layer.

properties.name: restriction
properties.description: (Optional) A schedule layer restriction block. Restriction blocks documented below.
Restriction blocks (restriction) supports the following:

properties.name: type
properties.description: (Required) Can be daily_restriction or weekly_restriction

properties.name: start_time_of_day
properties.description: (Required) The start time in HH:mm:ss format.

properties.name: duration_seconds
properties.description: (Required) The duration of the restriction in seconds.

properties.name: start_day_of_week
properties.description: (Required for weekly_restriction) Number of the day when restriction starts. From 1 to 7 where 1 is Monday and 7 is Sunday.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the service.

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Optional) A human-friendly description of the service. If not set, a placeholder of "Managed by Terraform" will be set.

properties.name: auto_resolve_timeout
properties.description: (Optional) Time in seconds that an incident is automatically resolved if left open for that long. Disabled if set to the "null" string.

properties.name: acknowledgement_timeout
properties.description: (Optional) Time in seconds that an incident changes to the Triggered State after being Acknowledged. Disabled if set to the "null" string.

properties.name: escalation_policy
properties.description: (Required) The escalation policy used by this service.

properties.name: alert_creation
properties.description: (Optional) Must be one of two values. PagerDuty receives events from your monitoring systems and can then create incidents in different ways. Value "create_incidents" is default: events will create an incident that cannot be merged. Value "create_alerts_and_incidents" is the alternative: events will create an alert and then add it to a new incident, these incidents can be merged.

properties.name: alert_grouping
properties.description: (Optional) Defines how alerts on this service will be automatically grouped into incidents. Note that the alert grouping features are available only on certain plans. If not set, each alert will create a separate incident; If value is set to time: All alerts within a specified duration will be grouped into the same incident. This duration is set in the alert_grouping_timeout setting (described below). Available on Standard, Enterprise, and Event Intelligence plans; If value is set to "intelligent"

properties.name: alert_grouping_timeout
properties.description: (Optional) The duration in minutes within which to automatically group incoming alerts. This setting applies only when alert_grouping is set to time. To continue grouping alerts until the incident is resolved, set this value to 0.

You may specify one optional incident_urgency_rule block configuring what urgencies to use. Your PagerDuty account must have the urgencies ability to assign an incident urgency rule. The block contains the following arguments:

properties.name: type
properties.description: The type of incident urgency: constant or use_support_hours (when depending on specific support hours; see support_hours).

properties.name: urgency
properties.description: The urgency: low Notify responders (does not escalate), high (follows escalation rules) or severity_based Set's the urgency of the incident based on the severity set by the triggering monitoring tool.

properties.name: during_support_hours
properties.description: (Optional) Incidents' urgency during support hours.

properties.name: outside_support_hours
properties.description: (Optional) Incidents' urgency outside of support hours.

When using type = "use_support_hours" in incident_urgency_rule you must specify exactly one (otherwise optional) support_hours block. Your PagerDuty account must have the service_support_hours ability to assign support hours. The block contains the following arguments:

properties.name: type
properties.description: The type of support hours. Can be fixed_time_per_day.

properties.name: time_zone
properties.description: The time zone for the support hours.

properties.name: days_of_week
properties.description: Array of days of week as integers. 1 to 7, 1 being Monday and 7 being Sunday.

properties.name: start_time
properties.description: The support hours' starting time of day.

properties.name: end_time
properties.description: The support hours' ending time of day.
When using type = "use_support_hours" in incident_urgency_rule you must specify at least one (otherwise optional) scheduled_actions block. The block contains the following arguments:

properties.name: type
properties.description: The type of scheduled action. Currently, this must be set to urgency_change.

properties.name: to_urgency
properties.description: The urgency to change to: low (does not escalate), or high (follows escalation rules).

properties.name: at
properties.description: A block representing when the scheduled action will occur.

The at block contains the following arguments: * type - The type of time specification. Currently, this must be set to named_time. * name - Designates either the start or the end of the scheduled action. Can be support_hours_start or support_hours_end.
Below is an example for a pagerduty_service resource with incident_urgency_rules with type = "use_support_hours", support_hours and a default scheduled_action as well.

resource "pagerduty_service" "foo" {
  name                    = "bar"
  description             = "bar bar bar"
  auto_resolve_timeout    = 3600
  acknowledgement_timeout = 3600
  escalation_policy       = "${pagerduty_escalation_policy.foo.id}"

  incident_urgency_rule {
    type = "use_support_hours"

    during_support_hours {
      type    = "constant"
      urgency = "high"
    }

    outside_support_hours {
      type    = "constant"
      urgency = "low"
    }
  }

  support_hours {
    type         = "fixed_time_per_day"
    time_zone    = "America/Lima"
    start_time   = "09:00:00"
    end_time     = "17:00:00"
    days_of_week = [1, 2, 3, 4, 5]
  }

  scheduled_actions {
    type       = "urgency_change"
    to_urgency = "high"

    at {
      type = "named_time"
      name = "support_hours_start"
    }
  }
}
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: service
properties.description: (Required) The ID of the service the integration should belong to.

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Optional) The name of the service integration.

properties.name: type
properties.description:
• type - (Optional) The service type. Can be: aws_cloudwatch_inbound_integration, cloudkick_inbound_integration, event_transformer_api_inbound_integration, events_api_v2_inbound_integration (requires service alert_creation to be create_alerts_and_incidents), generic_email_inbound_integration, generic_events_api_inbound_integration, keynote_inbound_integration, nagios_inbound_integration, pingdom_inbound_integrationor sql_monitor_inbound_integration.

    Note: This is meant for generic service integrations. To integrate with a vendor (e.g Datadog or Amazon Cloudwatch) use the vendor field instead.

properties.name: vendor
properties.description: • vendor - (Optional) The ID of the vendor the integration should integrate with (e.g Datadog or Amazon Cloudwatch).

properties.name: integration_key
properties.description: • integration_key - (Optional) This is the unique key used to route events to this integration when received via the PagerDuty Events API.

properties.name: integration_email
properties.description:
• integration_email - (Optional) This is the unique fully-qualified email address used for routing emails to this integration for processing.

    Note: You can use the pagerduty_vendor data source to locate the appropriate vendor ID.

    » Attributes Reference
The following attributes are exported:

properties.name: id
properties.description: The ID of the service integration.

properties.name: integration_key
properties.description: This is the unique key used to route events to this integration when received via the PagerDuty Events API.

properties.name: integration_email
properties.description: This is the unique fully-qualified email address used for routing emails to this integration for processing.

properties.name: html_url
properties.description: URL at which the entity is uniquely displayed in the Web app
To configure an event, please use the integration_key in the following interpolation:
https://events.pagerduty.com/integration/${pagerduty_service_integration.slack.integration_key}/enqueue
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the group.

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Optional) A human-friendly description of the team. If not set, a placeholder of "Managed by Terraform" will be set.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: user_id
properties.description: (Required) The ID of the user to add to the team.

properties.name: team_id
properties.description: (Required) The ID of the team in which the user will belong.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the user.

properties.name: email
properties.description: (Required) The user's email address.

properties.name: color
properties.description: (Optional) The schedule color for the user. Valid options are purple, red, green, blue, teal, orange, brown, turquoise, dark-slate-blue, cayenne, orange-red, dark-orchid, dark-slate-grey, lime, dark-magenta, lime-green, midnight-blue, deep-pink, dark-green, dark-orange, dark-cyan, darkolive-green, dark-slate-gray, grey20, firebrick, maroon, crimson, dark-red, dark-goldenrod, chocolate, medium-violet-red, sea-green, olivedrab, forest-green, dark-olive-green, blue-violet, royal-blue, indigo, slate-blue, saddle-brown, or steel-blue.

properties.name: role
properties.description: (Optional) The user role. Account must have the read_only_users ability to set a user as a read_only_user. Can be admin, limited_user, owner, read_only_user, team_responder or user

properties.name: job_title
properties.description: (Optional) The user's title.

properties.name: teams
properties.description: (Optional, DEPRECATED) A list of teams the user should belong to. Please use pagerduty_team_membership instead.

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Optional) A human-friendly description of the user. If not set, a placeholder of "Managed by Terraform" will be set.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: user_id
properties.description: (Required) The ID of the user.

properties.name: type
properties.description: (Required) The contact method type. May be (email_contact_method, phone_contact_method, sms_contact_method, push_notification_contact_method).

properties.name: send_short_email
properties.description: (Optional) Send an abbreviated email message instead of the standard email output.

properties.name: country_code
properties.description: (Optional) The 1-to-3 digit country calling code. Required when using phone_contact_method or sms_contact_method.

properties.name: label
properties.description: (Required) The label (e.g., "Work", "Mobile", etc.).

properties.name: address
properties.description: (Required) The "address" to deliver to: email, phone number, etc., depending on the type.
